page.title: 12THE CASTLE SITE, BOURNE
page.content: The hill around the castle is supposed to be where they made a tunnel either to the{Red Hall}or{Abbey Church.} The Bourne Eau gave the water supply to the castle as also did St. Peter's Pool. The{Wellhead}Cottage is now owned by the{United Charities.} It is supposed to have been built from the stones of the old castle. {The Darby {and Joan Hall}was built in 1959 and is now used for keep-fit classes, for old people to enjoy themselves and a meeting place for disabled people. Some nights meetings are also held in the hall. Although not Bourne's oldest building, Wellhead Cottage is very interesting. It was once known as Castle Farm.
